alert.note: Alert for Bandera; Edwards; Gillespie; Kerr; Kinney; Llano; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 05 at 4:19AM CDT until April 05 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS LIKELY ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE RIO GRANDE PLAINS, SOUTHERN EDWARDS PLATEAU, AND NORTHERN HILL COUNTRY TODAY DUE TO LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND GUSTY WEST WINDS... .Gusty west winds and dry air will move into the region this afternoon. In addition, hot temperatures along with the dry air will result in very low afternoon humidity levels in the single digits and low teens. The fire danger remains very high across the region. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE RIO GRANDE PLAINS, SOUTHERN EDWARDS PLATEAU, AND NORTHERN HILL COUNTRY... * WINDS...West 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 9 percent. * IMPACTS...Any wildfires ignited may spread rapidly and unpredictably.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Prevention of fire starts by avoiding planned burning, or by limiting activities prone to produce sparks. Take care to stop the start and spread of wildfires.

area.areaDesc: Bandera; Edwards; Gillespie; Kerr; Kinney; Llano; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde
